newsitem.title: USA: Key Tronic cites lower keyboard shipment.
newsitem.headline: Key Tronic cites lower keyboard shipment.

text.p: Key Tronic Corp said Friday it expects fourth quarter sales of about $45 million, which is a shortfall that it said is due to lower shipment volumes of its computer keyboards.
The company said the $45 million sales figure is based on preliminary unaudited results for the quarter ending June 30, 1997. The company said it also expects its profits to be lower than expected.
For the fourth quarter of ended June 29, 1996, the company reported net sales of $42.64 million.
The company said several of its distributors have delayed keyboard orders because they anticipate major price cuts in computer processors.
The company also said one of its customers has decided to discontinue a specific keyboard program earlier than expected.
